Forgot Prefix
Great idea! Imagine this in multiplayer.. o.o
Thanks Guys! And sorry for the delay if anyone was awaiting this from my previous video.
This was perfect timing Good job on the video!!! You've earned a Sub!!!

This came in handy when I did this:

Thanks for the tip Jager-Man.
Now I was just trying a near identical tactic for testing fighter planes on a target craft, but the target's throttle keeps cutting whenever it gets more than 50m away, any suggestions on how to fix?

Interest has been through the roof in my Jager-Man productions lately so I decided to get this tutorial up... finally XD

So, I had another go at trying this concept (in a much more destructive manner)...

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Now I was just trying a near identical tactic for testing fighter planes on a target craft, but the target's throttle keeps cutting whenever it gets more than 50m away, any suggestions on how to fix?

Are either of these aircraft still on the ground when this happens, or in the air?

I always find I glitch when I try to do anything like this the flying is fine but the game then will not let me go back to the space center or revert the flight any ideas as to why this is?

(the larger plane carries a third smaller one)

I always find I glitch when I try to do anything like this the flying is fine but the game then will not let me go back to the space center or revert the flight any ideas as to why this is?

I've never had this issue. What version are you running it in and are you sure you have zero mods or plugins in place?

Are either of these aircraft still on the ground when this happens, or in the air?

On the ground
Good job! Just can imagine how much time it takes to do it!

On the ground

If you note during the takeoff roll in my video, that is why I get both crafts off the ground as quickly as possible. For some reason, when they are on the ground and you toggle to a different entity, the throttle cuts by default on the craft you're no longer in control of. Once off the ground, the throttles will hold steady.
